entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With the 2508 release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition continues to embed Artificial Intelligence (AI) at the core of business processes, enabling organizations to work smarter, faster, and with greater confidence. This release brings new AI-assisted capabilities across finance, service, and user experience, empowering employees to make data-driven decisions, reduce manual effort, and focus on higher-value tasks. By combining embedded AI, generative AI, and SAP‚Äôs digital assistant Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 sets a new benchmark for intelligent ERP ‚Äî helping businesses unlock efficiency, innovation, and resilience in the cloud.

 1. Joule Copilots

1.1. Joule for Business

In today's fast-moving digital landscape, businesses need solutions that simplify processes and enhance efficiency. SAP‚Äôs Joule for Business stands at the forefront of this transformation. By embedding artificial intelligence directly into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Joule for Business acts as a digital assistant that helps users navigate complex tasks through natural language interaction. With its intuitive design and AI-driven functionality, Joule is not just an assistant‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic partner for every business user.

Simplifying Service Contract Management with Joule for Business

For Customer Service Managers, Joule for Business is a game-changer. It allows managers to express their business needs using everyday language, eliminating the need for specialized technical knowledge. Joule then guides users directly to key service management applications, such as the Manage Service Contracts app, Service Management Overview, and Service Contracts Dashboard. The result? Users experience faster navigation, enhanced satisfaction, and improved operational efficiency. By providing seamless access to apps like Mass Processing of Service Contracts and Monitor Auto Renewal Logs, Joule ensures that service contract management becomes a streamlined and user-friendly process.

Streamlining Solution Order Management

Joule for Business also empowers Solution Order Specialists to work more effectively. By understanding business requirements expressed in natural language, Joule navigates users directly to relevant solution order management applications. Key apps such as Solution Orders Overview and Solution Order Profitability are now just a simple command away. This not only saves time but also allows specialists to focus on core activities, driving productivity and enhancing decision-making. Joule thus bridges the gap between user intent and system functionality, transforming solution order management into a more accessible and efficient workflow.

AI-Assisted Sales Order Status Check

Beyond navigation, Joule for Business delivers tangible value in sales operations. With its AI-powered sales order status check, Joule enables businesses to monitor whether sales orders are on track and identify any issues hindering fulfillment. By translating complex fulfillment statuses into plain language, Joule helps users quickly understand bottlenecks, view potential causes, receive resolution suggestions, and seamlessly navigate to the appropriate applications. This functionality improves efficiency and accelerates issue resolution, ensuring that sales processes remain agile and customer-centric.

Read more about Joule: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant.html

 

1.2. Joule for Consultants

Joule for consultants is a conversational AI assistant designed to accelerate SAP project delivery. It achieves this by providing instant guidance grounded in an unmatched knowledge base that is exclusive to SAP and expertly curated. This foundation includes over 200,000 pages of documentation, SAP Notes, Knowledge Base Articles, and terabytes of content from SAP Communities. By tapping into this authoritative source, consultants can get fast, specific answers to complex questions, supporting every phase of a project from discover to run and saving up to 1.5 hours per day.

Beyond its extensive knowledge base, Joule offers powerful SAP-specific code intelligence, built upon a fine-tuned model trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code. This enables consultants to generate code from natural language prompts and significantly reduce the time needed to interpret unfamiliar code by up to 40%. The combination of expert guidance and advanced coding assistance directly impacts project timelines. This acceleration can shorten a typical 12-to-18-month project by up to 14%, translating to a reduction of 1.5 to 2.5 months in the overall project cycle

Read more about Joule for Consultants: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html

 

 1.3. Joule for Developers

Joule for developers is a generative AI assistant embedded within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity and accelerate the software development lifecycle. Its primary goal is to help developers write, test, and deliver optimized, bug-free code in ABAP Cloud in the shortest possible time. For developers working in environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this translates into a significant reduction in the time and effort required for both writing and testing code, leading to a faster realization of value from their development work.

The assistant provides several key capabilities to achieve this. It offers predictive code completion to generate ABAP code directly in the editor and a Joule chat feature for getting support on development questions using natural language. It can also explain existing development objects or selected lines of code to improve comprehension. To enhance quality, Joule assists in generating and improving ABAP unit tests and can create test classes specifically for CDS entities, helping ensure robust and reliable applications.

 

2. General Availability of AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

2.1. Simplify Asset Accounting with SAP Business AI and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In the Finance domain, we're enhancing the user experience with AI-powered innovations that transform the way fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. One of the standout features of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures. These insights are delivered in natural language and help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This capability simplifies interpretation, allowing users to grasp financial figures and value changes more quickly, enhancing productivity and reducing the time needed for recurring financial tasks.

Additionally, this innovation comes with AI-assisted asset master data creation, enabling users to enter data using simple conversational commands. This approach decreases the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces. SAP Business AI is central to these enhancements, providing detailed explanations and support that facilitate better decision-making and enhance user satisfaction. This release reaffirms SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

2.2. Group Reporting: AI-assisted Financial Business Insights for Group Financial Statements Review Booklet

Building on the successful beta release in 2502, predefined AI-assisted business insights‚Äîalso known as quick actions‚Äîare now generally available in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet. These insights help streamline financial review processes by highlighting key figures, variances, and relevant context in natural language.

The Group Financial Statements Review Booklet, Cost Centers Review Booklet, and Project Financial Booklet ‚Äì Professional Services now all include AI-powered business insights that enable faster analysis and easier interpretation of financial data. By reducing manual analysis effort and surfacing relevant context automatically, these booklets drive efficiency across various reporting tasks.

 

2.3. AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are excited to introduce SAP Document AI, a groundbreaking innovation that integrates generative AI into quality management processes. This advanced AI feature revolutionizes the handling of incoming quality certificates, significantly enhancing operational efficiency for our customers. By automating the extraction of relevant information from both paper and digital documents and incorporating it into SAP workflows, SAP Document AI streamlines the processing of supplier quality certificates. This leads to substantial reductions in manual efforts, faster processing times, and minimized human errors. As a result, quality technicians are liberated from monotonous tasks, enabling them to concentrate on more strategic and value-adding activities, which, in turn, helps companies expedite stock releases, minimize inspection-related production delays, and enhance overall throughput.

Moreover, SAP Document AI enhances accuracy and reliability by automatically matching quality certificates with system records and updating their status, ensuring that no document is misplaced and compliance is consistently maintained. Additionally, intelligent error handling fortifies system resilience and trust. One of the most compelling features of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience, offered as a ready-to-use capability that requires no custom development, thereby providing customers with immediate value and swift ROI. As we continue to incorporate AI, data, and automation into our ERP offerings, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition serves as a cornerstone for smarter, more agile operations. The introduction of SAP Document AI exemplifies our commitment to supporting customers in future-proofing their business, driving continuous improvement, and fostering innovation.

 

2.4. Unlock seamless data access with AI-assisted easy enterprise search 

Accessing business data is now even more intuitive with the AI-assisted easy enterprise search, which allows users to search using natural language. Instead of navigating through complex structures, a simple query like ‚ÄúShow me sales orders overall status in process‚Äù or ‚ÄúShow me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR‚Äù provides relevant results instantly.

The system adapts the search results based on the user‚Äôs role, ensuring that only the most relevant business objects are presented. This not only improves search accuracy but also accelerates insight extraction‚Äîmaking it easier to act quickly and confidently in a data-rich environment. To enable this feature, select the 'enable AI natural language search' checkbox in the user profile settings.

 

3. Beta Programs of New AI-assisted Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

3.1. AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release brings a new dimension of intelligence to the user experience with the introduction of the AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home. Currently available in beta testing, this innovative feature simplifies the resolution of business-critical situations by dynamically guiding users through resolution steps‚Äîdirectly from the homepage.

This smart solution leverages generative AI to adapt the user interface in real time, presenting timely insights and suggested actions tailored to the specific business context. Designed to support fast, informed decisions, it transforms traditionally manual and multi-step tasks into a seamless, click-efficient experience.

Accessible from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud homepage, the solution enables situation handling in just a few clicks‚Äîsignificantly reducing the time and effort required to take action. Instead of navigating through multiple screens, users are presented with dynamic cards that surface key information and associated actions. These cards act as entry points to resolve issues directly, eliminating the need for in-depth navigation and enhancing day-to-day productivity.

The substantial benefits of this innovation include saving time, reducing complexity, and improving the quality of decision-making. Generative AI delivers context-aware recommendations and outcomes that are both trustworthy and relevant‚Äîbuilt on enterprise-grade intelligence. This intuitive approach allows users to act confidently with minimal effort, ultimately boosting overall efficiency across key operational processes.

To illustrate its impact, consider a common example: a sales representative receives a notification that a sales quotation is about to expire. In a conventional workflow, the user would open the situation, navigate to the quotation, manually edit the details, save the changes, and then return to resolve the situation. With the AI-assisted solution in My Home, these steps are consolidated into a single, streamlined flow‚Äîdemonstrating how user effort is minimized while responsiveness is maximized.

Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. For more details, visit the Get Involved Early page to register and contribute to the evolving landscape of AI-driven business processes. 

 

3.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications 

Personalizing the My Home workspace becomes faster and smarter with the new AI-assisted smart personalization feature. Currently in beta testing, it allows users to tailor their applications and insight tiles using natural language.

Applications can be added in just two clicks, including a preview to confirm suitability. This streamlines customization, especially for new or infrequent users, by offering AI-powered suggestions, application descriptions, and live KPIs for dynamic tiles. The experience is intuitive and efficient, ensuring that personalization aligns with users‚Äô daily workflows.

Interested in experiencing these improvements first-hand? Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.3. AI-assisted easy fill 

Also in beta, AI-assisted easy fill reimagines how form fields are completed. Instead of manually searching for and filling out fields, users can enter data via natural language. The system intelligently matches input to the correct fields and provides a clear overview before confirmation.

This innovation saves time, reduces navigation complexity, and increases accuracy in form completion. With automatic field matching and editable previews, easy fill offers a new level of convenience for maintaining business objects efficiently.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 delivers a powerful set of innovations that bridge insight and action with the support of generative AI. Whether it's optimizing financial processes, enhancing personalization, or improving sustainability reporting, these features demonstrate SAP‚Äôs commitment to building a truly intelligent cloud ERP system.

Interested in experiencing this enhanced feature?‚ÄØJoin the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and contribute to shaping future developments. For more information, see: Get Involved Early, and register today to help drive the evolution of AI advancements. 

 

3.4. AI-assisted payment exception analysis

In the Manage Automatic Payments app (App ID: F0770), a new AI capability enhances the process of analyzing payment exceptions after a payment proposal run. This feature not only provides natural language explanations of payment exceptions but also highlights relevant log entries and suggests resolution actions.

This innovation reduces the time spent investigating and resolving issues in payment proposals. By guiding users directly to the root cause and recommended next steps, the process becomes significantly more efficient‚Äîimproving payment accuracy and minimizing delays in financial operations.

 

Explore Joule Base and AI-assisted Features for Free

With Joule Base Entitlement in the SAP Store, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers can consume all of our Joule features in 2508 release for free. 

We‚Äôre also pleased to share that three recently introduced AI-assisted user experience innovations‚Äîeasy enterprise search, easy filter, and smart summarization‚Äîare now available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition at no additional cost. With SAP Cloud ERP Base AI Entitlement here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customers  can consume Easy Filter, Smart Summarization and Enterprise Search for free. To get started, simply accept the SAP AI Terms. Once completed, we‚Äôll reach out to enable these capabilities on your tenants, so you can immediately begin benefiting from more intuitive interactions, faster insights, and enhanced productivity

 

Explore everything about Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP here.

 

Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for all presentations. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand‚Äìanywhere, anytime.

 

Find all our assets

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: Join the Beta: Understanding tax calculations with Joule
entry.content:
Are you ready to influence the future of tax localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

We‚Äôre inviting customers to participate in the beta testing program for a new Joule capability: Understanding Tax Calculations.

 

This feature, available for early access with release 2508.2, uses Generative AI to deliver real-time, contextual explanations of tax logic applied in posted sales orders. The current scope focuses on Sales Order-based tax calculations for India.

Billing clerks often spend valuable time interpreting tax rules to ensure compliance. This capability simplifies that process by providing clear, human-readable insights‚Äîdirectly within the application. The result: faster reviews, fewer errors, and greater confidence in tax accuracy.

As a beta participant, you‚Äôll test the feature in your own SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and engage in regular feedback sessions with SAP‚Äôs development teams. Your input will directly shape how this AI-powered localization tool evolves.

Key Dates

  • Registration: July 1 ‚Äì September 30, 2025
  • Program Start: October 20, 2025
  • Duration: 90 days

Seats are limited. To participate, you must be an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner and sign a Test Evaluation Agreement.

Ready to get involved? Check out the Beta Testing program page and click the Register button at the top left to secure your spot.

entry.title: First Experiences GenAI-driven extensibility assistant for Custom Fields and Custom Logic app
entry.content:
These are my first experiences with the extensibility assistant

Use within Custom Fields:


You can call the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields app start screen, and in the details screen of a single custom field.

Calling the extensibility assistant in the start screen:

Example Prompt :Create a Z field in the Journal Entry Item Level , Field Name : Reference1 and Field Description : Reference 1_HD , Data Type : Char/Text Field Length : 20 and Enable it for the RAP BO I_JOURNALENTRYTP

In the initial screen of the Custom Fields app on the button bar at the top right of the custom field list, you'll find a open assistant button. 

Enter the prompt it will preselect Business context

 After selecting the right context accept the proposal from SAP it will create the field and enable to edit for detail screen 

Calling the extensibility assistant in the details screen:

  • On the button bar at the bottom of the screen, you'll find the diamond button.

  • if you want to ask about a custom field displayed on the details screen, you can refer to it using expressions like ‚Äúthis field‚Äù. A common use case is seeking assistance to expose the field through an OData service, UI, CDS view, or SOAP API.

  • Once selected Press save and publish manually . As you see from the below the field is automatically extended in the SOAP API section based on the prompt .

 

Use within Custom Logic:

  • Start the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic app by clicking the Open Assistant button on the implementations table toolbar

 

  •  The extensibility assistant will show a list of BAdIs that fit your request or a message if no BAdIs were found. 

Select and create implementation . This will only help to find right BADIs not generation of the coding in the BADI üôÇ

entry.title: SAP Activate for SAP BTP : End-to-End Guidance for SAP Integration Suite - Now with Joule!
entry.content:
We‚Äôre thrilled to announce a major enhancement to the SAP Activate Roadmap for SAP Business Technology Platform - it now includes end-to-end guidance for implementing SAP Integration Suite capabilities.

This update brings clear, actionable direction for managing integration projects from start to finish. Even better, the content is aligned with SAP‚Äôs Integration Solution Advisory Methodology (ISA-M) - SAP‚Äôs strategic framework for building and managing enterprise integration effectively.

And now, with the integration of Joule, accessing and consuming roadmap content has become an even more intelligent and user-friendly experience.

What‚Äôs New

With this roadmap expansion, organizations gain structured guidance to plan, implement, and govern their integration architecture on SAP BTP. This includes support for both new integrations and migration from legacy solutions - all while applying best practices from ISA-M.

Whether you're beginning your cloud journey or optimizing existing integrations, this content helps you move forward with clarity, governance, and agility.

Why It Matters

In today‚Äôs complex landscapes, integration is critical ‚Äî and often underestimated. The enhanced roadmap supports integration leaders, enterprise architects, and project teams with a structured, phase-by-phase approach to reduce risk, align teams, and accelerate outcomes.

By embedding ISA-M principles throughout each phase, the roadmap ensures that integration strategy remains aligned with business priorities, clean core principles, and SAP‚Äôs reference architectures.

Updated SAP Activate for SAP BTP Phases with Integration Content:

Discover
Define your integration vision and scope, aligning business needs with strategic planning. Set the stage for a structured integration journey.

Prepare
Establish governance, form key teams, enable stakeholders, and assess your current integration landscape. Lay the technical and organizational groundwork.

Explore
Set up the SAP BTP environment and activate Integration Suite. Design your integration architecture, Define Best Practices, and prepare for testing.

Realize
Develop and migrate integrations, implement DevOps and transport processes, and run detailed testing. Prepare for cutover and operations support.

Deploy
Go live with the SAP BTP solution, execute cutover plans, and transition to support. Resolve outstanding issues for a stable launch.

Run
Operate your solution efficiently and continuously improve. Leverage SAP BTP and Integration Suite innovations to evolve with business needs.

Joule: An Intelligent Way to Access SAP Activate

To make the roadmap even more accessible, SAP Activate for SAP BTP now includes Joule - a digital copilot embedded into SAP‚Äôs ecosystem. Joule enables users to engage with Activate content in a natural, intuitive way, offering real-time answers and guidance tailored to your role and project needs.

No more digging through documents or searching manually. With Joule, you can simply ask a question and receive contextual, task-specific support ‚Äî helping you navigate complex projects with greater ease and confidence.

Joule brings a more intelligent experience to SAP Activate, empowering teams to make better decisions, faster. Watch the video below to learn how to access Joule from within SAP Activate Roadmap for SAP Business Technology Platform

  

 You can access this enhanced content now in the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer, under SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform. Whether you‚Äôre building new integrations or optimizing existing ones, and whether your environment is cloud, hybrid, or multi-cloud ‚Äî this roadmap supported by Joule, helps ensure your success.

Keep the Feedback Coming 

We continue to gather feedback from our own customer community, our SAP experts, and partners, and we follow an agile methodology to build on the previous version and continuously improve the content.

In the past, your feedback has driven meaningful improvements. Whether it was simplifying navigation, creating new tasks, or updating accelerators, your input has helped us focus on what truly matters to you, during your implementation journey.  You can help us improve by providing feedback in the following ways 

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to the blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com
  3. Leave us your comments in the section below.
Thank you for your continued engagement with SAP Activate!

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management & Risk 2508 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Supplier Management Integration with WalkMe (SLP-2265)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and SAP Ariba Supplier Information and Performance Management (new architecture) with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

Supplier Management WalkMe integration includes several standard smart walk-throughs from SAP Ariba for common workflows. Customers can also choose to develop their own content by first purchasing WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. For more information about WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions, see https://walkme.com

If you have an SAP Companion help system enabled, its help content remains available.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in Supplier Management (SLP-2258)
Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in supplier management. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

(IMPORTANT: AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance will be in early access until September 19th, 2025, at which time it will be made generally available to customers.)

View implementation details and more here.

For the list of tasks that you can perform using Joule, refer to the topic Joule Capabilities in Supplier Management.

 

Displaying Comments when Updates are Requested for a Modular Questionnaire (SLP-2272)
Modular questionnaires allow continuous updates or permanently close after the submitted answers are first approved or denied. Requesting an update reopens the questionnaire so that the recipient can update it once. When you request an update to a modular questionnaire and enter an (optional) comment about the update request, the comment along with its timestamp is now displayed in the Comments section of the modular questionnaire.For example, the comment is displayed in this manner: "UserXYZ has requested an update for questionnaireABC".

View implementation details and more here.

 

Option to Join the SAP User Research Panel (SRISK-1771)
This feature provides you an option to join the SAP User Research Panel, where you can share your thoughts and ideas to enhance SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and other SAP products you currently use.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Inherent Risk Screening Questionnaire Information (SRISK-1415)
This feature introduces a new version of the Supplier Risk Engagements API. In addition to the other existing capabilities, this new version lets you retrieve questionnaires, answers, and answer types of inherent risk screening questionnaires to provide better insights to plan your organization's operational needs.

View implementation details and more here.

 

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk Integration with WalkMe (SRISK-1714)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Risk with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Domain-Based Residual Risk Score (SRISK-1731)
This feature enables Supplier Risk Engagements API to retrieve domain-based residual risk score for Information Security, Data Privacy, and Compliance domains at the control, engagement, and supplier levels.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Risk Exposure Summary Report Displays Overall Residual and Inherent Risk Levels (SRISK-1763)

This feature provides information about the inherent and residual risk levels of suppliers in the Risk Exposure Summary report. This crucial information aids in making informed decisions when engaging with suppliers.

In addition to the existing risk exposure information, the Risk Exposure Summary report now includes two additional columns to provide inherent and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Changes to the User Interface - Currently, the Risk Exposure Summary report summarizes the overall risk exposure, and category-wise risk exposure such as legal and regulatory, environmental and social, and operational risk exposure. This enhancement introduces two additional columns to display overall inherent risk level and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Stay connected with our community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2508 release (August 12-14, 2025)
  • Resources
    • Feature related materials:
      • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
      • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
    • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
    • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement and Network
    • What‚Äôs New
    • SAP Products and Services YouTube channel - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLWV533hWWvDk7zRbhOsWQkF5BGWokhHYH
    • "Spend Management and Business Network" playlist - https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL3ZRUb1AKkpSPtGOGv41NrN_6_WwyiYrF&si=29zqqpUPaRoKUvU4

Make sure to check out our other blogs and subscribe to our authors to keep up-to-date with the latest and greatest innovations!

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 6: SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur
entry.content:
This sixth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur. For SAP Customer Experience, look at the new AI agents and the capability to build custom agents, plus AI innovations for marketeers in SAP Emarsys, and Joule and AI order summaries in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2.  SAP Concur takes travel planning to the next level with the whole new travel experience, complemented by the new Joule Booking Agent enabling users to use natural language to book a trip.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 

SAP Customer Experience

The user experience highlights I have picked are all AI-related:

  • AI Agents.
  • SAP Emarsys UX innovations.
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 UX innovations.

This news article summarizes what‚Äôs new overall for SAP Customer Experience, beyond UX-related innovations:

  • Connected for Growth: What‚Äôs New with SAP Customer Experience in Q2 2025.

AI Agents

As I explained in part 1 of this series, AI agents work in the background to give a greatly enhanced user experience. A number of powerful AI agents are available for SAP Customer Experience, via the package Joule Premium for Customer Experience. This blog post and video give a nice overview of three of them in action:

  • AI Agents in Action.
  • Video: See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service (3:11 min.)

The latest UX innovations are:

  • Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant.
  • Digital Service Agent (via Early Adopter Care program).
  • Ability to create custom agents in the CX AI Toolkit.

AI Shopping Agent for the SAP Commerce Cloud Shopping Assistant

The shopping agent helps customers when visiting an online shop: they can simply use natural language to state what they are looking for, and the shopping agent will respond with suitable suggestions. Figure 1 shows an example, where the user starts out by stating that they are looking for shoes to wear for two mile long walks while wearing a suit. Two shoes are suggested, and the user asks which one is comfortable right away, since he doesn‚Äôt want a long break in period. The agent recommends one model, and the customer then asks for a recommendation for a belt to match, which the agent promptly gives him.

Figure 1: Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant from SAP Commerce Cloud. Alt Text: three screenshots of a tall and narrow screen showing a chat, one for each of the interactions explained in the main text. Each response shows one or two images: in the first case two shoes, then one shoe and then one men‚Äôs belt.

Find out more here, and watch the video embedded there to see it in action:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Shopping Agent

Digital Service Agent

The new digital service agent helps to provide your customers with a great user experience, similar to how the shopping agent is aimed primarily at your customers. It enables customers to ask questions with natural language and provides answers based on your company‚Äôs business knowledge residing in the SAP system. Hence, it is able to resolve common inquiries and issues, giving customers a good experience. Furthermore, by freeing up you sales and service team to focus on more complex inquiries, your customers will also receive a better service and hence better experience.

The digital serice agent is currently only available for select customers via the Early Adopter Care program. Figure 2 in the next section shows how these customers can select it in the AI Agent Builder.

Find out more here:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Digital Service Agent.

Create Custom Agents with CX AI Toolkit

You can now create your own custom agents with the CX AI toolkit. Figure 2 shows the start screen for the AI Agent Builder, where you can select ‚ÄúCustom Tool‚Äù to start the wizard which takes you through the steps to create a custom agent.

Figure 2: The AI Agent Builder in the CX AI Tookit for creating custom AI agents or using SAP templates to create AI agents. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Create AI Agents‚Äù in large text in the middle below an illustration, below in much smaller text ‚ÄúStart by selecting an Agent Template‚Äù. Below that, two rows of three cards representing Agent Templates are shown: Custom Tool, Knowledge Agent, Classification Agent, Digital Service Agent, Q/A Agent, and Shopping Assistant Agent.

Find out more here:

  • Documentation: Create a Custom AI Agent.

Further Information on AI Agents for SAP Customer Experience

For a deeper understanding of the power of these AI agents, have a look at this longer video:

  • Video: SAP CX AI Toolkit: AI Insights Agents for SAP C4C & Shopping Assistant | Product Inspiration Series (32:21 min.)

SAP Emarsys

AI-Assisted Report Builder using Natural Language

You can now easily create a report using natural language to describe what you are interested in. Figure 3 shows an example of the entry screen. At the bottom you see hints on what kind of queries you can enter.

Figure 3: AI-assisted report builder in SAP Emarsys. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúUnlock the Power of Data with the AI-assisted Report Builder‚Äù in the middle. At the top a text entry field containing the query ‚ÄúWhat are the Sent, Delivered, Bounced, Opened, Clicked, Purchased, Unsubscribed, Complained for my Email campaigns in the past month?‚Äù, to the right an AI button ‚ÄúGenerate Report‚Äù. At the bottom of the screen two example queries are listed.

Once you have created the report, you can easily adjust it using a set of convenient filters, such as the date range as well as the list of campaigns and metrics. Watch this video to see it in action:

  • Video: AI-assisted Report Builder (46 seconds).

AI-assisted Product Finder using Natural Language (Pilot)

Pilot customers can now try out the new AI-assisted product finder, which allows users to search for product to add to marketing campaigns using natural language. Figure 4 shows an example of how to enter your search text, see more here:

  • Video: AI-assisted Product Finder (38 seconds).

Figure 4: AI-assisted product finder available to SAP Emarsys pilot customers. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a screen with a left half containing the Product Finder, with a search field containing ‚ÄúMost popular shoes in the last 6 month‚Äù, above an empty space with the text ‚ÄúWelcome to Product Finder!‚Äù in the middle. The right half shows an image of someone dancing in the sun and an image of a dress, along with some describing text.

Read more about latest SAP Emarsys innovations here:

  • SAP Emarsys Q2 2025 Product Release.
  • SAP Emarsys introduces new generative AI capabilities in June Product Release

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Joule in SAP Sales Cloud

Joule is now available in SAP Sale Cloud Verion 2, helping users get quick insights, for example about an account. As you can see in Figure 5, these insights can be charts as well as text based.

Figure 5: Joule for SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot of Joule showing Customer Account Overview, with the text ‚ÄúShow Key Metrics‚Äù entered as chat, below which a card with a vertical stacked bar chart shows credit limit usage (remaining amount and exposure amount), below that a card showing Key Metrics (Activity) and part of a donut chart for Tasks, Phone Calls, Appointments, Visits etc.

Have a deeper look here:

  • Video: Intelligent Selling with Joule in SAP Sales Cloud & SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Product Inspiration Series (16:04 min.)

Sales Order Summary

The Sales Order Summary uses generative AI to summarize key information about the sales order, as well as including information about some changes, for example how the price compares to the original price. Figure 6 shows an example, with the insights shown on the left of the screen.

Figure 6: Sales Order Summary in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a sales order, with the left third showing an overview with AI-generated insights such as ‚Äú13 days past requested date‚Äù, ‚ÄúOverall discount is EUR 808.55‚Äù. On the right, the Order Summary tab is shown, with account name, net and gross value, pricing stats, above ‚ÄúProducts in Cart (2)‚Äù showing a list of two products, followed by the top part of a list of pricing steps.

Learn more here:

  • Documentation: Sales Order Summary.

 

SAP Concur

The new Concur Travel experience makes it much easier to book travel involving multiple bookings, such as a flight plus hotel plus rental car. And if you just need to book one item, you can do that very easily now with the new Booking Agent powered by Joule.

New Concur Travel Experience

When travelling for a few days, one often needs to book more than one item. A typical combination is booking a flight, a hotel and a rental car. Up until now, you have had to book each item separately and take care that the dates and time match. Now, with the new Concur Travel experience, planning and booking is much easier: you can enter the start and end dates for your flight, and the new feature Match Flight Booking is applied to the hotel and car, so that dates and time match automatically.

Figures 7 to 11 show what this looks like: Figure 7 shows the start screen, where you select which items you want to include (flight, hotel, car, train). Figure 8 shows the flight view, where flight dates have been entered. Figure 9 shows the hotel search, with the default selection ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù, and similarly Figure 10 shows the rental car search, with pick-up and return times calculated based on the flight schedule. Figure 11 shows the finalize screen, in this case showing that the flight and hotel has been selected but the rental car is still open.

Figure 7: New Concur Travel experience start screen. Alt Text: A screenshot of a pop-over with a large image of a magnifying glass on a globe, above the text ‚ÄúStart Planning‚Äù. Below that four check boxes in a row: Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train, at the bottom ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù buttons.

Figure 8: New Concur Travel experience screen with flight details. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a trip planning for a Trip to Las Vegas. The left third of the screen shows a list with items Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, with Flight selected. Below the list buttons ‚ÄúAdd to trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúSearch‚Äù. On the right a selector for round-trip (selected), one-way or multi-city, with fields for from / to locations and a date field for the stard and end date. To the right a button ‚ÄúTime preferences‚Äù and a drop-down for selecting ‚ÄúCabin‚Äù.

Figure 9: New Concur Travel experience screen with hotel details. Alt Text: As for Figure 8, but with Hotel selected, and on the right Hotel Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúHotel, location, or name‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù.

 Figure 10: New Concur Travel experience screen with rental car details. Alt Text: As for Figure 9, but with Rental Car selected, and on the right Rental Car Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúPickup‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù and the field ‚ÄúDrop-off‚Äù filled with ‚ÄúSame as pickup‚Äù. Pickup Time and Drop-off Time fields have 10:00 AM entered.

Figure 11: New Concur Travel experience finalize screen. Alt Text: Screenshot showing ‚ÄúTrip to Las Vegas‚Äù on the left two-thirds, with a card summarizing the flight with United Airlines from San Antonio, TX (SAT) ‚Äì Las Vegas, NV (LAS) and a card summarizing the hotel Courtyard by Marriott Las Vegas. The right third shows the Estimated Total Cost $2497.85 above a list with the cost of each item (flight, hotel, rental car), and buttons for ‚ÄúFinalize Trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel Trip‚Äù, and options to book anything else (Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train).

As you can see in Figure 11, another advantage of the new experience is that you get budget transparency at the trip level. Also, you have flexibility to book parts of the travel now and other parts later.

Technically it supports deep linking, which means that you can send a trip-level link to colleagues which includes all the trip parts, making it easy to coordinate trip planning when travelling with others.

To find out more, have a look at the

  • Documentation: Trip Planning in New Concur Travel.

Booking Agent in Concur Travel

The new Booking Agent lets you use natural language to book business travel which is compliant with company policy and budget constraints as well as taking into account your personal travel preferences.

Figure 12 shows an example where the user has simply stated ‚ÄúI want to book a flight from San Francisco to London on Sept 9th and back on Sept 13th‚Äù. The answer shown takes into account the user‚Äôs frequent traveler memberships, flight availability and company policies.

Figure 12: New Concur Travel Booking Agent in Joule. Alt Text: A screenshot of Concur Travel with Joule opened on the right, the content is explained in the main text, with the possible flights listed alongside a thumbnail image representing the airline ‚ÄújetBlue‚Äù.

Watch it in action and find out more:

  • Video: Concur Travel ‚Äì Booking Agent demo (2:33 min.)
  • SAP Discovery Center: Booking Agent.

 

Continue Reading - UX Innovations in UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile

I hope you enjoyed this sixth part, covering SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur, with great new AI-powered user experiences helping users work more efficiently and effectively.

Here is the link to the final part seven, covering latest innovations in UI design and technology for web and mobile:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: No More Guesswork: Joule‚Äôs Help Content Makes SAP Fieldglass Easy to Use
entry.content:
Joule for SAP Fieldglass is a productivity accelerator embedded directly into your SAP Fieldglass experience. Joule uses natural language processing to help users complete tasks, retrieve documentation, and make decisions faster‚Äîall without leaving the application.

Whether you're creating job postings or navigating other tasks, Joule delivers smart, contextual guidance. It‚Äôs like having a support expert built right in.

Use Case: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

This is a common need in SAP Fieldglass ensuring continuity for tasks while away.  Instead of digging through manuals users can ask Joule:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

Joule delivers the relevant help documentation from the SAP Help Portal, complete with step-by-step instructions. This access to help content empowers users to self-serve confidently‚Äîboosting adoption and user experience.

With Joule, SAP Fieldglass becomes intuitive, responsive, and user-friendly. 

Next steps

1) To see more uses cases see the help documentation here - https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Fieldglass/76e97fe0cccf4d37a5dadc652a375e33/e3dc12e0215447cfa4507eff66e8224b.html?q=joule+for+fieldglass&locale=en-US&version=LATEST

2) Register for the upcoming webinar entitled AI in SAP Fieldglass ‚Äì Current Capabilities & Innovations:  https://event.on24.com/wcc/r/5044009/B1F114D7F58F199C9B327A0AF0C678ED/5192177?mr=s
or catch the replay: https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg20.jsp&eventid=4435612&sessionid=1&key=A3DE53CEDE437303128D05B9BAC0AFFA&groupId=6091913&sourcepage=register 

3) Reach out to your Customer Success Manager for more information.

entry.title: End to End Activation Guide for S/4HANA public Cloud and SAP Business AI - Joule
entry.content:
SAP Business AI - Joule in S/4HANA public Cloud

    End-to-End activation guide for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP AI-Copilot

 

  1. Introduction:

SAP Business AI is SAP‚Äôs integrated approach to bringing artificial intelligence directly into business processes, applications, and user experiences.

Its core strength is contextual intelligence‚Äîleveraging master and transactional data while respecting each user‚Äôs role and authorizations.

There are two Main pillars in SAP AI Strategy.

  • Custom AI Solutions via SAP BTP AI Services ‚Äì e.g., SAP AI Core, Launchpad services.
  • Business AI ‚Äì native AI capabilities embedded across SAP‚Äôs applications.

 

 

  1. In a previous blog, I covered building custom AI in BTP . ‚Äú#Vectorize your data for Infuse AI in to Business using Hana Vector and Generative AI‚Äù.
  2. This post focuses on the second pillar‚ÄîStarting from a clean SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant activation and enabling Business AI - Joule (AI copilot) setup.

2 On-Boarding process of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition for TDD:

This section covers entitlement ordering, system provisioning, tenant activation, identity services setup, and post-onboarding configurations for the Test, Demo & Development (TDD) edition.

2.1 Order the CBC, IAS/IPS & S4 Tenants :

Log in to SAP Partner Portal with your S-user. [ https://partneredge.sap.com/].

Request TDD license; admin receives welcome emails with CBC, IAS/IPS & S/4 tenant URLs and admin credentials.

2.2 Provisioning  the Technical System:

System provisioning can be done  via 'SAP for Me‚Äô.

The sequence of system provisioning should be CBC , CIS Sync up[IAS/IPS], SAP S/4 HANA Dev and Customizing Tenant.

2.3 CBC Set up:

  1. Configure Scope and Organisational Structure in CBC.
  2. Create an Evaluation Project (not Implementation).
  3. Assign required CBC roles.
  4. Select demo data during initial project setup.
  5. Ensure deployment targets point to your S/4HANA Public Cloud URL.

 

           

2.4 Additional CBC Set UP and guidelines:

  • Find CBC URL: CIS ‚Üí Applications ‚Üí XSUAA ‚Üí CBC ‚Üí Home URL.
  • Replicate CBC groups to CIS via IPS resync job.
  • Assign correct CBC roles in IAS and maintain correct user IDs to avoid login issues.
  • Validate target system properties in CBC admin console.

 

2.5 User Setup in CIS & S/4:

Once all the set ups are done , you can see the below FLP looks like this.

You can use the identity access MGMT tile to onboard the new users , roles and groups.

By default, the Super Admin is assigned the SAP_BR_Administrator role along with other standard SAP roles in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud application.

The best practice is to Create the custom roles from the template and assign to the user instead of assign the standard role.

To onboard a new user you can follow the below steps in CIS and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud.

3. Enabling Business AI Copilot (Joule) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

This purpose of this guide is to provide step-by-step instructions on how to set up a Joule that can work in SAP SAP S/4 HANA public Cloud Edition.

3.1 Validate the Joule service assignment.

 In BTP Entitlements, ensure Joule is assigned.

Add missing service plans and Save

        

 

3.2 Validate SAP BTP Build Work Zone- Standard Edition.

  • Add Work Zone in entitlements if missing.
  • Ensure Joule and Work Zone are in the same global account, subaccount, and region where Joule is available.
  •  you need to carefully choose the right data center where Joule is available and nearest to your location.

       

3.3 Validate the System Registration in BTP : [Auto-Discovered / Manual]

In the SAP BTP cockpit, you can have the overview of all your systems associated with your customer ID. These systems can be registered or auto discovered.

Make sure that your SAP S/4 HANA DEV and Customizing Tenants ,  CIS Tenant  and CBC Tenants which you are configured earlier are exists here . If not you need to add it manually in the BTP Global Account √† System Landscape Systems link.

 

3.4 Get the token for your system from BTP and Register it in S/4HANA Cloud Tenant

Choose your SAP S/4 HANA public cloud Tenant in the system Landscape-->Systems--> Choose All Communication Scenarios --> Get Token

Capture the registration token and keep  and login in to SAP S/4 HANA cloud .

Register this token in Maintain extension link and Click on Approve  button as YES.

 

Once this is completed , Refresh the system landscape button , and you can see your SAP S/4 HANA cloud system status shown as registered in green color.

3.5 Set up the subaccount , Spaces and Cloud Foundry.

As part of your sub account creation , make sure that you are going to choose the right region where joule data centers are available.

Once sub account has been created , create the Cloud Foundry and Space.

3.6 Set up the Entitlement in the subaccount.

Go to your subaccount √† Entitlements--> Add service Plan -->Search Joule and work zone and add those services.

  • Setup Trust Configuration

From the Navigation Pane on the left, select Trust Configuration. Click Establish Trust.

From the CIS  tenants, choose the one that is also used by your applications and click Next.
Note: The tenant chosen here must be the same as the one used by SAP S/4 HANA Cloud application for which Joule is configured.

3.7 Trust the Domain in BTP.

Need to  add the Trusted Domains. To do this, click on the Settings options in the Subaccount and click on Add under Trusted Domain.

   

3.8 Trust the Domain in SAP Cloud Identity Services

Click on CIS√† Applications and Resources -> select Tenant Settings -> and then click on Customization -> click on the Trusted Domains option -> add your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URLs

3.9 Create the service key for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

This  Service Key which will be used during the destination creations and for SAP CIS ‚Äì Identity Provisioning Services (source & target) role mapping to your Work Zone.

 

Assign the required roles as well for the users.

3.10 Run the Joule Booster in the BTP Global account

BTP Global Account--> click Boosters >> search for Joule >> click Start on Setting up Joule tile.

 

 

Finally you will get the success message like this.

3.11 Post Booster Validation.

The formation created here is a logical grouping of SAP systems. Once the formation is created, you can include an SAP solution system in it and change it anytime.

 

 

3.12 Create Navigation Service Destination

We need the destination services for Joule to work with your LoB applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. To create this, SAP BTP Subaccount, --> Connectivity option --> Destination --> Create New Destination.

 

You have to use the Service Key for the Joule.

This contains client id , secret  Token URL..etc.

3.13 SAP S/4HANA Destinations setup in BTP Subaccount 

Navigate in to BTP Sub Account  --> Click Connectivity -> Destinations and confirm the destinations required for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition are successfully created in your BTP Subaccount. The following 5 destinations should already exist in your BTP S4HANA_PUB_SSO

  • SAP S/4HANA SSO
  • Joule Design time Destination
  • Joule Run time Destination
  • Runtime Default
  • Runtime Datas

Already you have created the ‚Äúnavigation service‚Äù manually.

3.14 Validate the Communication Arrangements:

Navigate in to  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System -->  launch the Communication Arrangements Tile.

Confirm that Communication Arrangements with Scenario ID SAP_COM_0647 and SAP_COM_0882 are automatically added by the Joule booster.

 

 Make sure SAP_COM_0647 exposure role collection is set to ALL.

 

The navigate in to Communication Systems Tile.

You can 4 new systems are created. The System ID and System Names will have cryptic values.

3.15 Create the Inbound Communication System:

Navigate to Communication system √† Create the new one-->Specify the host name and port and create the communication user Id and proposed  password.

For the communication arrangement choose SAP_COM_0193  and save it.

3.16 Create Communication Use for the communication System step

Create the  Communication User . Navigate to --> Maintain Communication Users -> Click on New and enter the details 

Capture this user id and password will be used in Source system creation step.            

3.17 Manage Content Security Policy

Navigate to SAP S/4 HANA Cloud--> Manage Content Security Policy √† Trusted Sites--> Managed By--> UI_RESOURCES_SCRIPTS --> Managed by Customer tab--> Add the URL of the Joule.

This Joule URL you can get it from the BTP cockpit ‚Äì Joule Service.           

3.18 Configure the IDP for SSO set up between Source and the Target System.

Here the

  • Source system is SAP S/4HANA Public cloud
  • Target system is SAP BTP Build zone standard edition.

You have option to create the system manually or upload the template of Source and Target System.

Find the attachment of the ZIP file.  From this template you can easily create the source and target files.

 

Go to CIS console -->  IDP --> Source System --> Click Add --.> Browse and Upload the Source File.

Update the properties as per screen shot.

Here you need to update the User and Password captured from the STEP 15 [Communication user creation step in S/4 HANA]

 

Target System Creation:

Upload Target JSON file by click on ADD button in the IDP-->Target system.

Proceed the update the details and properties.

Source System -  Earlier you created.

cflp.providerId :   ID of the S/4 content provider created in Work Zone.

URL : portal-service url from the from the  Work Zone instance in BTP.

OAuth2TokenServiceURL :  URL from the Work Zone instance in BTP should be ends woth oauth/token.

User: clientid 

Password: clientsecret 

3.19 Provision Users and Groups from S/4HANA Cloud to Work Zone

Navigate in to Identity Provisioning >> Source Systems--> Choose the system you created --> Job--> Read Job--> Click Run Now button.

In the provisioning Logs , verify the log status.

You can find the status of the user and groups  in Work Zone channel manager by click on refresh button.

3.20 Verify Joule in SAP Fiori Launch Pad / Work Zone.

Enter the URL of the SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud in the browser --> You can notice the DIAMOND icon of  JOULE in the TOP right corner.

Open and enter your queries in the interactive assistant.

4 Conclusion:

In this blog post , I have covered the end-to-end steps for set up the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenant in TDD environment and activate the Business AI- Joule.

Following that I provided the detailed steps like Onboarding , Provisioning the system, CBC set up, CIS IAS /IPS set ups , BTP service activation ,  Boosters for the service , System and user set up , Trust and SSO set ups.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile
entry.content:
This seventh and last post in my series gives an overview innovations in our UI tools and technologies, making it ever easier to design, build and integrate UIs, for both web and mobile applications. For designing apps, web and mobile, we have a new SAP Design System portal and UI Kits in Figma. For developers, we have added further AI assistance, as well as many individual improvements, including support for the latest international accessibility standard WCAG 2.2. Fun fact: SAPUI5 is now used on all 7 continents ‚Äì yes, Antarctica too! 

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

The above post also gives an update on building your own Joule agents, so I will not cover that here, but rather focus on web and mobile UI development.

 

Design News

SAP Design System Portal and UI Kits in Figma

We recently introduced the new SAP Design System portal that brings together the product design guidelines SAP Fiori for web, SAP Fiori for iOS, and SAP Fiori for Android, as well as to the new digital design system guidelines. With its enhanced usability, simplified versioning and improved performance, designers (and developers!) get a better user experience compared with the previous SAP Fiori design guidelines.

Figure 1: The SAP Design System portal start page. Alt Text: Image with header saying ‚ÄúSAP Design System‚Äù, with a ‚ÄúSee what‚Äôs new‚Äù button below it, and then four subsections in a horizontal row: SAP Fiori for Web, SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for iOS and SAP‚Äôs Digitial Design System. A ‚ÄúFeedback‚Äù button is on the bottom right.

The new UI Kits available for designers in Figma make it easy for designers to design accessible UIs at enterprise scale, for web applications, mobile iOS and Android applications as well as wearables. The UI Kits provide reusable components for web and mobile, along with web floorplans, which give you what you need out-of-the-box.

Figure 2: SAP‚Äôs UI Kits for Designers in Figma. Alt-Text: The image shows two rows of four cards representing UI Kits: SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for Web, Designing for Performance, SAP Fiori for iOS, SAP Fiori for watchOS, SAP Fiori for Wear OS, SAP S/4HANA for Web, and Accessibility Design Tools. On the very left of the image information about SAP is listed, with links to resources such as www.sap.com/design-system.

Find out more here:

  • New SAP Design System Portal for SAP Fiori Design Guidelines, and New UI Kits for Designers.

Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite

Consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products ‚Äì no unexpected surprises. We have identified areas directly relevant to users and plan to introduce a number of design updates in SAP Fiori for web across our suite of products to further increase consistency.

The areas we have redesigned and which we plan to provide across our suite of products this year and next year are:

  • Shell bar (at the top of the user‚Äôs screen)
  • Navigation menu: side navigation (see Figure 3 below).
  • User menu
  • Notifications
  • Search in the shell bar

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition already supports the first four of these, you can have a look at them in part 2 of this series, in the section SAP Fiori Launchpad and Design Updates for Suite Consistency:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

As outlined in Part 1, SAP Build Work Zone standard edition also supports side navigation.

Find out more about these design updates here:

  • Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web).

We also provide designers with a refreshed new set of illustrations, to be used for illustrated messages. Figure 3 shows some examples.

Figure 3: Examples of new illustrations. Alt Text: On the left top three different size illustrations showing an ice cream cone fallen on the ground; bottom left an illustration of a globe with a magnifying glass, representing ‚Äúsearch‚Äù. On the right an image of a list report showing the search illustration since no data has been selected.

 

News for Creating Web UIs

Extensibility made easy with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is made much easier since we introduced the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard. The latest update introduces the ability to create an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension.

Figure 4: Creating an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension. Alt Text: Screenshot showing step 1 ‚ÄúExtension‚Äù task where users can select from a row of four cards ‚ÄúCustom Field‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Logic‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Process‚Äù and ‚ÄúUser Interface Extension‚Äù. The latter has a subtext ‚ÄúAdapt the current application or extend it visually with a new application‚Äù. The latter two cards have a link ‚ÄúManage SAP Build Projects‚Äù at the bottom. The bottom right shows two buttons ‚ÄúNext‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù.

Learn more here:

  • SAP Build Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

AI-assisted auto-fix of coding errors with UI5 linter

UI5 linter is the tool of choice to check your UI5 project for using best practices and replacement of deprecated SAPUI5 APIs. With UI5 linter v1.12.0, we are happy to announce the initial version of an autofix feature: Use the "--fix" argument to let UI5 linter apply fixes to your code automatically. Read more about it here:

  • Migrate your code with UI5 linter ‚Äì Autofix has landed.

Legacy-free version of SAPUI5 available via cloud access

Once you have removed code which uses deprecated SAPUI5 APIs, you can try out the legacy-free version of SAP UI5 in the cloud, which has all deprecated code removed. Discover the benefits and how to try it out in this blog post:

  • Explore SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free.

Accessibility taken to the next level: WCAG 2.2 support

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards gives applications a true cutting edge, ensuring that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2.

For example, two of the key new requirements in the 2.2 version are:

  • The minimum target size of an interactive element now needs to be 24x24 px, so that users don‚Äôt accidentally activate a neighbouring element.
  • Each operation that can be performed by dragging can also be performed alternatively without dragging ‚Äì so that people who cannot use a mouse to drag can still use the UI.

See more details:

  • SAPUI5 is Leading the Way in Accessibility with WCAG 2.2

SAP Fiori tools ‚Äì open source, faster app creation, more AI

One of the most powerful recent innovations is the AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools, which allows you to create a fully functional app with database tables, CDS-Views, OData service and a Fiori element list report UI based on a sketch of what you want. I introduced this in my Q1 update post from March. This can now be started from Joule in SAP Build Code. Also, it has been further enhanced, and is also available as open source, so that our developer community can make contributions themselves. Find out more here:

  • From idea to app: using AI-powered Project Accelerator to develop SAP Fiori apps
  • SAP Fiori Application Generator Available in Open Source

For those of you developing in ABAP, we have introduced the new quick SAP Fiori application generator to create and deploy simple SAP Fiori applications from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. Have a closer look:

  • Quickly Generate and Deploy SAP Fiori Apps from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse

To get an overview of these plus some additional enhancements, have a look at:

  • SAP Fiori tools 2506 update ‚Äì Open source, faster app creation, adaptation boost, AI enhancements.

Enhancements for SAP Fiori Elements with OData V4

We are continuously enhancing SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements. I have picked two enhancements to highlight here for developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4, which are covered in the following subsections:

  • Support for inline edit for object pages.
  • Support for the analytical table on the object page.

Support for inline edit for object pages

You can now develop object pages where users can directly edit fields within facets, without having to first press the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button and go into edit mode. Figure 5 shows an example from a test application.

Figure 5: Inline editing of fields in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of part of an object page ‚ÄúTravel‚Äù, which is overall in display mode, but the field ‚ÄúStarting Date‚Äù has been selected and is editable, with a new entry made, and ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù icons next to the field.

Support for the analytical table on the object page

For applications where users need to be able to analyze the data in a table, for example grouping data and aggregating data, developers should use the analytical table rather than the responsive table.

These tables are often used for the ‚Äúlist‚Äù part of an SAP Fiori elements list report, which consists of a list and an object page for the details. Now, developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4 can include an analytical table into one of the facets of an object page. Figure 6 shows an example.

Figure 6: Analytical table in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of an object page with a facet ‚ÄúJournal Entries (4)‚Äù which contains an analytical table, where the entries are grouped by ‚ÄúCase Journal Entry‚Äù. One of the groups is expanded, showing two lines. Below them the sum of the debit column is shown for the expanded group, and below that for the entire table.

Further Updates for SAPUI5

As I described in part 1 of this series, we have introduced a new option to preview an upcoming SAPUI5 version for SAP Build Work Zone. This capability aims to provide a controlled environment for evaluating SAPUI5 updates in SAP Build Work Zone, thereby avoiding immediate changes in production environments:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

Key users can create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility. I described this in the context of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in part 2 of this series (section Key Users Can Rearrange ID and Description Within a Field or Column). They can also easily change the labels used, to fit terms established within the company. Read more about this here:

  • How Key Users Create Consistent Text Changes with SAPUI5 Flexibility.

SAPUI5 has reached a new milestone: it is now used on all 7 continents. Yes, we have reached Antarctica!

  • SAPUI5 adoption becoming more universal.

In case you have not updated your system for a while, then be aware that we are removing SAP Fiori themes Belize and Blue Crystal. Also, make sure that you are using the latest browser versions, which may mean ensuring that your users laptops and desktops are using newer operating system versions:

  • Upcoming Removal of SAP Fiori Themes Belize and Blue Crystal
  • Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 Downtime ‚Äî Check Your Browser Strategy Today!

To get a complete overview of all the enhancements in SAPUI5 including SAP Fiori elements, look at the UI5 demo kit. You‚Äôll find some of the enhancements mentioned above listed under version 1.136.

  • What‚Äôs New in SAP UI5.

 

News for Mobile Designers and Developers

The main news for mobile designers are the new SAP Design System portal, which covers Android and iOS as well as the latest releases of the mobile Figma design kits for Android, iOS, WatchOs and WearOS.

Figure 7: The Android and iOS pages in the new SAP Design System portal. Alt Text: Both screenshots look the same, except for Android vs iOS text. The top has a ‚ÄúGet Started‚Äù section, with a row of cards to navigate to UI Elements, UI Kit, Development Documentation. Below that a ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New‚Äù section, with information about the latest release ‚ÄúSAP Fiori for Android version 25.8‚Äù and ‚Äú‚Ä¶for iOS‚Ä¶‚Äù.

The best place to stay up-to-date with these latest enhancements is the respective What‚Äôs New section in the SAP Design System portal:

  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS 25.4: What‚Äôs new for SAP Fiori for iOS
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.8 (design preview) and 25.4: What‚Äôs new for SAP Fiori for Android

Figure 8 shows two of the many new enhancements: the new illustrations mentioned earlier in the section on web UIs are also available for mobile, both for iOS and Android. The other example shown there is the updated date picker for Android, which now allows users to select date ranges.

Figure 8: On the left, an example of the new illustrated messages for mobile. On the right, date ranges can now be selected in the date picker for Android. Alt Text: The illustrated message is used in a pop-over. The illustration shows a sheet of paper with a tickmark, below that the text ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre all caught up‚Ä¶‚Äù and two buttons ‚ÄúAdd Task‚Äù and ‚ÄúRemind Me Later‚Äù. On the right two date screens are shown for the month of April: the left one has the 8th marked, the right one has the range from 8th to 16th marked.

Developers get new features with the latest releases of the mobile SDKs, as well as the the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) which is integrated into SAP Build Code. Here are links to find out more about them:

  • What‚Äôs new in Mobile development kit client 25.6, for example:
    • Support grouping in Object Table Control
    • Donut chart support
    • ‚Ä¶ and more.
  • Continuous Innovation in Mobile Design & Technology: SAP Fiori for Android and iOS 25.4
  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS: What‚Äôs New in 25.08
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.4.0 is now available

 

Final words

As you can see from all seven posts in the series, we continue to progress rapidly with the user experience of our product portfolio, especially with regards to AI-assistance.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

For general information on design at SAP and SAP Fiori, check out:

  • www.sap.com/design.
  • www.sap.com/fiori.
  • SAP Community: SAP Fiori topic page.

„Åæ„Åö„ÅØ‰∏ãË®ò„ÅÆÈÄö„Çä„ÄÅGitHub‰∏ä„ÅÆ„É™„Éù„Ç∏„Éà„É™„Çí„ÇØ„É≠„Éº„É≥„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ

‰∏ãË®ò„Ç≥„Éû„É≥„Éâ„ÇíÂÆüË°å„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„É™„Éó„Éà„ÇíËµ∑Âãï„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ

 „Åì„ÅÆ„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Ç§„É≥„Çø„É©„ÇØ„ÉÜ„Ç£„Éñ„Å´ÊâãÈ†Ü„ÇíÂÆüË°å„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Ë®≠Ë®à„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ1~12„Åæ„Åß„ÇíÈ†ÜÊ¨°ÈÅ∏Êäû„Åó„Å™„Åå„ÇâÈÄ≤„Çì„ÅßË°å„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ 

 1. Document Grounding „Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„ÅÆÊúâÂäπÂåñ 

„Åæ„Åö„ÄÅSAP BTP‰∏ä„Åß Document Grounding „ÅÆ„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„Çí‰ΩúÊàê„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åì„ÅÆ„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„ÅåJoule„ÅßÁ§æÂÜÖ„Éâ„Ç≠„É•„É°„É≥„Éà„ÇíÂèñ„ÇäÊâ±„ÅÜ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÅÆÊäÄË°ìÁöÑ„Å™Âü∫Áõ§„Å®„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ 

  1. „Åæ„Åö„ÅØ„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„É™„Éó„Éà„ÇíËµ∑Âãï„Åó„ÄÅ„É°„Éã„É•„Éº„Åã„Çâ „Äå1. Create Document Grounding Instance„Äç „ÇíÈÅ∏Êäû„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
  2. Document Grounding„ÅÆ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„ÅÆÂêçÂâç„ÇÑ„Åù„Åì„Å´ËøΩÂä†„Åô„Çã„Çµ„Éº„Éì„Çπ„Ç§„É≥„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Çπ„ÅÆÂêçÂâç„ÇíÊ±∫„ÇÅ„Å¶ÂÖ•Âäõ„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ‰ªäÂõû„ÅÆ‰æã„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Åù„Çå„Åû„Çå„Äådocument-grounding-other„Äç„Äåsb-document-grounding-other„Äç„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åì„ÅÆÂÖ•ÂäõÂÄ§„Å´Âü∫„Å•„ÅÑ„Å¶„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„ÅÆÊåáÁ§∫„ÅåË°®Á§∫„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÈÄö„Çä„Å´Ë®≠ÂÆö„ÇíË°å„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ
